messages.message: The one Hannah linked does not have any provenance info being sent to human review for the main fields where it is expected.

the hidden fields do seem to have provenance info being sent to human review, but the non-hidden fields the user sees does not.

@Elan Sharony do you know where provenance data is added to fields or should we link someone from flow execution or build?
It looks like we return provenance for refined phrases in the response from /open-files:

Elan in most cases I do see provenance, I'm more so unsure why in Hannah's case here we don't. Similarly with Melissa's case.

Melissa's case may be related to the provenance being returned only being informational?
cc @Sayd do you know what can cause certain fields within a doc to not have provenance?
Model isn't guaranteed to return provenance information. Especially for let's say reasoning fields
Most of my fields are extraction fields. These aren't complicated docs and they've previously returned provenance. This is a regression.

What Hannah and Melissa are seeing is different. I still have to look into Melissas then because it does show a page number but does not show the provenance on the page. Hannah's just doesn't return provenance to human review which is a separate thing entirely.
